channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC

item.title: Report X-2024010115
item.description:
Report X-2024010115

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-08T00:36:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-28
  • City: RALEIGH
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE DUE TO THE RATTLE SOUND OF AN AEROSOL CAN. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (1) 8 OUNCE CAN OF FLAMMABLE DUPLI-COLOR PERFECT MATCH PREMIUM AUTOMOTIVE PAINT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2023120616
item.description:
Report X-2023120616

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-04T15:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: RAEFORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UPON ARRIVAL TO THE TERMINAL, PACKAGE WAS FOUND WET AND SMELLING STRONGLY. IT WAS PULLED FROM THE BELT AND PLACED IN A DAMAGE BIN AND GIVEN TO THE QA TEAM FOR INSPECTION. AFTER INSPECING, IT WAS FOUND TO BE A LOOSE CAP ON A BOTTLE OF REAGENT'S FORMIC ACID 90%. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED INTO A DAMAGE BIN UNTIL PROCESSED AS A DAMAGE.

item.title: Report E-2023120475
item.description:
Report E-2023120475

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-03T15:12:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: CHINA GROVE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 21, 2023, two (2) 48-pound boxes of UN3262 were damaged during transit and released approximately one (1) product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized absorbent pads, a degreasing agent, and bleach to collect any residual product from the impacted area. Crews restacked the undamaged cargo for normal transport. All HA Powder (UN3262) impacted material was collected and containerized in two (2) 5 Crews utilized hand tools to collect released HA Powder 5-gallon drums and R+L personnel took possession.

item.title: Report X-2023120901
item.description:
Report X-2023120901

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: NEWTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by QA in the unload area from a trailer from another facility. Package was found on the ground with the topside of the package and side being wet. Action took place for cleanup at 6:30am DescribePack: Package failure cause was a repack with insufficient inner packaging and loose caps. Upon inspection QA found that there is one cardboard liner resting on top of bottles of liquid and no other packaging. Lids on plastic bottles were loose causing small spillage to occur and damage outer packaging. four of four alcohol bottles were leaking inside of package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was transferred into a hazardous waste bin lined with a hazardous bag. Other packages around area was inspected but no other damage was found to nearby packages

item.title: Report X-2023120924
item.description:
Report X-2023120924

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: DURHAM
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials tote and taken to the hazardous materials staging area away from personnel and other packages. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was noted that the cap came off one of the plastic jugs of degreaser causing the contents to spill. There was no packaging in the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials drum awaiting disposition.

item.description:
Report X-2023120885

  • City: WHITSETT

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found saturated and leaking. The box was moved into the hazmat cage and placed in the hazmat tote DescribePack: Upon inspection of the package 2 of the 1 gallon jugs lids were loose causing the leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in the hazmat tote with orientation arrows point in the correct direction
